intro: Ptyssiglottis leptoneura, commonly known as the slender-veined ptyssiglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with finely divided, linear leaflets and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
